alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 26 at 11:09PM EDT until June 27 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Clay Creek Near Newark. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 14.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 04/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (11 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date White Clay Creek Newark 13.0 11.3 Mon 11 p 5.3 MSG 14.8 2am 6/27 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 500 AM EDT.
